alert.note: Alert for Inyo (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 27 at 9:04PM PST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT PST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor roadway flooding caused by snowmelt is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of southeast California, including the following county, Inyo. * WHEN...Until midnight PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water has been reported flowing over Highway 395 near Olancha RV Park and low lying portions of State Route 190. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 903 PM PST, local law enforcement reported flooding in the advisory area. Overflowing poor drainage areas have already caused minor flooding in the advisory area. - Highway 395 near Olancha RV Park and State Route 190 are the most likely places to experience minor flooding. Light to moderate rainfall is expected in this area, which will result in minor flooding. Should flooding impacts continue past midnight, this advisory may need to be extended. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Olancha, Cartago, Keeler, Grant, State Route 190 between Highway 395 and Saline Valley Road. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
